turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Well kids...have the bans been announced yet?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't be smart.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: I'm not smart...I'm stupid, remember. I'm so stupid that you have to look out for me, remember?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Johnny, I swear to God, if you open your mouth about any of this...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Me?  I wouldn't say a word to my aunt and uncle...or even your uncle, Charlie...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You threaten me with my uncle? After what I'm doing for you?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: What you're doing for me isn't worth it...believe me!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Take it.  I'm doing it for you, stupid!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: No you're not...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh, cut it out, will ya?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Charlie, twenty-eight bucks is nothing.  The only way to do it is through your uncle...think about it will you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: NO!!!  What do you think I am, crazy???

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: No, I just want to help myself, that's all.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't you move!!!

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: I'll be here.  Don't worry.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Back so soon.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Mind your own business.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Hello, Michael.  I've got something for you...not much...but...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: He has about twenty-eight bucks... it's all he has on him.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: I think we should see your uncle.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: This can't be settled any other way now...I'll take full blame.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Forget it.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: What are you going to do?  Hide me?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Good idea.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: Hey...you're here.  They told me you're here...and you're here.  How are you?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ok, how's everything going?

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: Don't ask...do you have any idea what I've been doing all morning...eh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: I was in the basement fixing the pipes.  Would you believe that?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What pipes?

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: What pipes...the ones from last year...those pipes.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: Look Charlie, you're a good boy. Will you just tell your uncle that I have nothing.  There is nothing to give him.  No envelopes with cash inside, no checks, nothing.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That bad, huh?

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: I can't make this week's payment and if this keeps up not next week's either.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Not next week's either...listen...you tell that to Giovanni, not me.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: Listen, I should wrap up this place in a ribbon and hand it to him, you know that.  I don't need this aggravation.  I'm getting old.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: He'd rather have the loan payed, you know that.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: Your Uncle's a good man...I won't stick him.  Either he gets the money or the place and right now he's getting the place.  And tell me why should I care?  I got a partner who's a bum, who doesn't help out...who disappears and leaves me with all the problems.  I should go back to Florida...I don't need this.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I don't understand, where's Groppi?

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: I should know?  His wife don't even know.  Probably off with one of his little girls...I don't know.  I tell you, if he don't give a damn, then I don't give a damn...Why should I kill myself?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: My uncle figured that this week was bad...but about next week...I dunno. Maybe you should speak to him yourself.

turns.speaker: OSCAR
turns.text: What can I say?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh great...hey - Winstons?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: For these prices don't be particular. That's all they had - but next week we'll see...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: OK, ok...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sell 'em if you can't smoke them.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No...I'll be ok for a week.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You seen Johnny Boy tonight?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Nope...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Isn't he supposed to be here tonight...I mean...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Look...I don't know.  What am I supposed to be, his keeper or something?  Yeah, he's supposed to be here but who knows what goes on in his head.  Right?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'd like to know Charlie, it looks like your little friend is trying to duck me...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: ...Charlie, don't you think you should be interested in Johnny's payments to me?  I think you should be, you know that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Michael, nobody's out to screw you, I guarrantee that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I know that Charlie but look at my side.  You undersigned the loans. You vouched for him.  What happens if this kid don't pay me?  I gotta collect from you?  I don't want to do that.  I made a deal with him not you, right?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're right.  You're right.  Look, I'm not gonna wind up paying his debts.  You know that.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I don't know that.  That's what I'm telling you.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Michael, believe me.  You know the kid's a little crazy sometimes.  I vouched for him and he'll come through.  I promise.  I'll talk to him and straighten him out.  Don't worry, OK?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: OK.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Michael, give us a lift.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: OK, get in.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Hey, shut up.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Get him in.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Disgraceful.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ok...that's it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Out!!!!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: C'mon Johnny.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You getting out too?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah, thanks, it's ok.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh Michael, look...

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nevamind 'look'...This punk bastard...I call him at work...I say 'Johnny Boy there?'...He doesn't even show up for work anymore...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Look...I've talked to him and I've talked to him...what more can I do...?  Tonight at the party all three of us get together and we knock some sense into his head...ok?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: All right...but understand, I don't like being taken advantage of.  I mean you're in there talking with your uncle and all...This is embarassing.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We'll settle it tonight.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What's a'matter?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Nothin'.  Just stiffed those kids. Don't want'em comin' back and findin' you...start asking you questions.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Let's go to the movies...on you.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Well, he isn't.  Nice...real nice.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: He'll be here.  Look, take this for now.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You kiddin.  The way it is now this isn't even interest for two hours.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: How much was the original loan again?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: $500.  He borrowed that because he wanted to pay off his other loans... now, counting the interest...it's almost $3,000.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: $3,000.  Shit!  Can we hold it at $3,000?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Charlie, this is business.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: 'But I say to you, love your enemies, do good to those who hate you, and pray for those who persecute...'

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: I'll tell you who you can pray for... Next payday, I'll be at Tony's Place...Johnny better show or I find him and break his legs...and I mean it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: 'But I say to you not to resist the evildoer; on the contrary, if someone takes thy tunic, let him take thy cloak as well...to him who asks of thee, give; and from him who would borrow of thee do not turn away!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: He could at least show some respect and show his face, even if he doesn't have the money...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: 'Amen I say to thee, thou wilt not come out from it until thou hast paid the last penny.'

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You said it.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Be seeing you and Johnny tonight... here...right?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: We'll be here.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Look, Michael, I'll get him here. What do you want me to do, kill him?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Whatever.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Where's the rest?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah, where's the rest?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're really crazy.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You're not going to use that gun, Johnny.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Diane, how are you feeling?

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You know Diane...I've been wanting to talk to you for a while now...er... a...  aside from all that joking around we do out there...when you're on...I... a...I really...think that you're a terrific performer...

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, I'm serious...You're really good.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: In a little while...I'm gonna have the opportunity of opening my own place...not here...much nicer than this...uptown...sort of nite-club and restaurant and everything.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: That's nice.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I was thinking maybe you'd do very nicely for the place.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Stripper?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No...no stripping...as the hostess.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Hostess?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah, you know...you greet the people...see them to their tables... well...it'll be different though... Listen...why don't we get together and talk after your show tonight.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Chinese food?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ok.  Chinese.  We'll meet on the corner of 6th Avenue and Waverly Place after you finish.

turns.speaker: DIANE
turns.text: Why not here...Ok nevermind...6th Avenue and Waverly.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Bye.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Uncle, how are you feeling?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Fine.  Did you have a good time last night?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: About that shooting last night...I was there and...

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: No you weren't.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You're right uncle.  I must have gotten it confused with something else.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Yes, you did.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: About Oscar...I think he put on this act...about the restaurant being in bad shape and all that. He can't make the payments...I don't know what to make of it.  He says Groppi's run off with a girl. I could help if you want.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: No...his business is bad.  But I'll decide what to do and you...and you just keep out of anything that might...might...er draw attention to you.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Take a drink!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ok.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Hey, where you been?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh...around...why?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You heard what happened to GROPPI, eh?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Who me? ...No, I don't know, not me...all I know is...

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Our friend, Groppi, went to his mother's house.  And when he was there...at night...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I really couldn't believe it when you told me, you know that?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Well, he was always a little crazy... he puts a gun in his mouth...  ...like your friend...comme si chiama...Henning?  Heming?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Hemmingway.  Killed himself.  I was more upset about that than about Groppi, that's for sure.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: You know, this boy over here, once, long time ago, tried to enrich my mind...so he gives me a book by this Hemin fella...to read, so I read it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh yes, he's pretty good.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: What I don't understand is why you have to go to college to read these books that you're gonna read anyway.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: ...but it's the same thing, all the same...they're in there by having something on somebody...and when that doesn't work...they fight...Our life has honor...we have no show to put on because we do what we have to do.  They know where to come when they need us.  I realize this during the war...World War II...Vito Genovese... during WWII he worked with the government, taking care of the docks...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What did he do?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: His whole family has problems...his cousin, the girl who lives next door to you...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Teresa.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: ...The one who's sick, right?  In the head.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No, she's got epilepsy.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Yeah.  That's what I said, sick in the head.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Her mother and father come to me and ask advice...she wants to leave...get her own apartment...worries them sick...what am I gonna tell them?  Lock her up?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: What do they expect you to say?

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Who knows?  It's not hard to figure out what she'll wind up like.  When the respect for parents breaks down, that's bad...you know I'm "cumpari" with them...so I take an interest.  You live next door, keep an eye open...but don't get involved.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: All right.

turns.speaker: GIOVANNI
turns.text: Well, maybe you missed something?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh yeah, that's a possibility.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Wasn't a book...was a short story.

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: What was it?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: No, c'mon...Y'know, I read.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: "Francis Macomber."

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: Wha?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: "Short Happy Life of Francis Macomber."

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: Oh yeah...didn't read it but I saw the movie...Gregory Peck...pretty good.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: It's only a couple of courses...just for the draft.

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: Charlie, couple of courses isn't enough to get you student deferred... I mean if they wanted to draft you, you would've been drafted by now.

turns.speaker: MARIO
turns.text: Why don't you take a look around the place if you want?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Oh, that's ok...I've been in and out of this place fifty times.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I'd like to eat something before I go back to work.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Ok, we'll go for lunch.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Do you have enough?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well...with the hotel that's ten... fifteen...

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Here.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Please take it.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well...

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I don't mind.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Sure...it's not that...I mean...

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well, if things go the way I hope they'll go, this money business will take care of itself.  God willing.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: An apartment uptown?  Downtown?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Maybe, who knows.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Charlie...?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Nobody knows anything, believe me.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: See if you can get your hands on some pamphlets on laws or by laws...or proprietorship...you know...at your place.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Anything specific?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You know...like restaurants, night clubs...

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: What is it now?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Don't ask.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Alright... Hey, did you hear any more about what happened last night?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Did you?

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: CHRIST, you should have seen it. Unbelievable.  The kid would turn around and fire and he would just keep coming at him like Rasputin. That kid was scared.  Not half as much as we were though.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: It doesn't make any sense.  He wouldn't shoot him just because he insulted a racket guy...not unless it was personal.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You missed the point.  The kid's a climber...not very bright...but if you get down to his level to look at it his way; he kills a guy who insulted a big man - he gets a reputation.  He thinks he's in good standing.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: It's still sick.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Not sick...just stupid.  Speaking of stupid, your cousin last night was feeling so good he decided to break into your mother's house...to get some food.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: C'mon Charlie...one more day.  I'll call in sick for work.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No...we can come back in a couple of weeks.  Besides, if we're both gone for three days it wouldn't look right.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Ok.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Bore.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: A paper on that one too?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Yeah...but don't worry about that now.  The Hemmingway one is first.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: It was nothing.  I'm almost finished.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Take your time.  I don't care.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I know you don't.  You've been very preoccupied lately.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That's the word...preoccupied.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: See that...know who lives there? The name George Earhardt mean anything to you?

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Sure...He lives there?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: No.  Of course he lives there. Would I point it out to you if he didn't?

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: That W.A.S.P. bastard.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: You're intolerable today.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Watch your language.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I'm going to take that apartment uptown.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Uhuh...probably a good idea.  Why don't you do it this time?

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: You know why...with my parents.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Well you can't blame them in a way.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I can take care of myself.  You know that.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: I know...I know.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: ...He must have heard the name from those T.V.'s in the hall that were blaring all the time.  I remember GUEVARA was in town at the time. Must've heard it from there I guess...but that's funny, isn't it?

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Ummmmmmmmmmmmm.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Of all people.  Now say the truth. Do I look like Che Guevara.  C'mon.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: I'm sleepy.

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: You've been running round too much. Bet you've been forgetting your medicine.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: The green capsules in the top drawer.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: The building on the corner.  That one!  He's been on the roof a half hour now!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Now don't get excited.  Don't get excited!!

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Teresa?...Yeah, Charlie.  Listen, I'm looking for your cousin.  Yeah, well today's Tuesday, payday.  I haven't seen him all day...no...well, have you got any idea where he is?  I know it's early yet but I'm just getting worried that's all...

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: Charlie...I've got to see you.  I want to talk...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Honey, I can't talk now...I've gotta run, bye.

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: But...

turns.speaker: CHARLIE
turns.text: Are you sure he didn't say anything to you about tonight?

turns.speaker: TERESA
turns.text: For God's Sakes...I told you before...nothing.  Charlie, I can't stay in here too long at this hour...will you please listen to me?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Lower the fuckin music--I can't hear nothin.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: The girls like it loud.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Girls?  You call those skanks girls?!

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: What's the matter with this kid?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: I feel fine--nothing wrong with me.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Don't count it...it's all there.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Count it.

turns.speaker: JOEY
turns.text: Hey, c'mon - no bullshit - friends.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: and a double for you and Charlie here.  And put it on my tab, willya?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Which one, the big tab or the little tab?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Put it on the little tab so that it balances with the big one.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Yeah, so things'll be even.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Will you guys shut up with the witches and tigers.  Tony, you gonna close the place, we get out of here, get something to eat, or what?

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: We'll close up as soon as everybody leaves.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Scumbag--

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Hey Johnny, where're you goin'?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Sal!... fourteen street.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: This is some boat.  Your father's?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Yeah...just had it delivered...

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Hey... you got stereo.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Yeah, I think so.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Ah...there's a funny lookin' cab behind us.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: I know...I know.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: What'sa matter...forget your registration?

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: No...no.  Nooo...it's just that I...I...uh... this ain't my car.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Yeah, it's your father's.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: Well...no.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: You mean it's heisted.

turns.speaker: SAL
turns.text: You could say that.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: This is a heisted car!

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: How about me?  I don't get a drink John?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Of course!  A double for Michael, Tony.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: I know what you're going to say but don't say it.  These drinks are all on the tab.  I'm gonna see you this Tuesday payday, I promise.  I give you my word.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: You what?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Just keep him quiet.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Friends of yours Michael.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Shut up.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY BOY
turns.text: Must have been all the liquor in him.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Quiet please.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Not bad.  $20.  Here, $5.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Can you spare it?

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: TONY
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: MICHAEL
turns.text: Ok guys...have a heart.  This is my business.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: I'm Allison, you're 'honey'.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Drew called from the AStar, they're still two minutes away.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Hi, everybody.  Sorry to be late -- had to have dinner with my depart- ment chief --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: You ate?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: ...I'm here, aren't I?  Wouldn't miss a loose end meeting.  What's on the table for discussion?  Party favors, flowers -- hi Dad, hi Drew --

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: That's your name?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: And isn't it a lovely one?  So sturdy, so straight --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: ...We're never all together two nights in a row.  Maybe Christmas, Thanksgiving, that's it.  What's going on?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Nothing's going on.  Maybe he doesn't want to be alone.  He's go- ing to be sixty-five in a minute --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: ...I don't know, Daddy seems funny to me.  Ever since Joe showed.  It's like he dropped from the clouds...

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: -- But he does seem very nice.

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: You think so?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Look who's talking.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Yeah, speak for yourself.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Dinner?  Again?

turns.speaker: SUSAN
turns.text: Haven't you had enough of us, Dad?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Did you speak to the Governor?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: He's coming.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: His wife?

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Unfortunately.  I sat between them at the Bronx Zoo benefit -- it was better than Seconal.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Daddy!  Come on, a name.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Yeah, Bill, the suspense is killing me.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Just plain 'Joe'?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Love that name.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: That was 'Joe'.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: He's cute.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Very.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Did he?  That's more than we get to do.

turns.speaker: DREW
turns.text: Well, maybe next time Joe goes, he'll take us along.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Daddy!

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Hi, Allison --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Have you got a minute?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Not much more.  Big day in the big city.  What's on your mind?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Fireworks.  Update -- we're con- structing the number '65' on the barge, archers from the State College at New Paltz will shoot flaming arrows at it, when it catches fire it will give us the effect of a Viking funeral with none of the morbidity... The Hudson River Authority says, for you, they'll make a special dispensation - of course there'll be an overtime bill for the Poughkeepsie Fire Dept...

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Allison, I trust you.  This is your thing.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: But it's your birthday.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I hate parties --

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Calm down, Daddy, you'll see, you're going to love it.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Isn't it enough to be on this earth sixty-five years without having to be reminded of it.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: What, honey?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: I lay awake nights in a cold sweat, I want this party to be like some- thing Mom would have made for you, I want it to be perfect --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: I know you do, darling.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: And you could care less --

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: Oh, you couldn't be more wrong, sweetheart.  I can' tell you how much I appreciate it and how I'm looking forward to it.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Good.  Songs.  What songs should Sidney -- Pancho and his six men we can forget about -- what songs do you think he should play?

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Daddy.  Does your friend have a name?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: A name?

turns.speaker: PARRISH
turns.text: -- Black.

turns.speaker: ALLISON
turns.text: Whew, at last.  Nice to meet you, Mr. Black.
